title: Customize your maps
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt)  q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,      y = lat,     group = group,     fill = location_code   ),     color="black",   size=0.1 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q

title: Customize your maps
text: also possible specify color user-defined groups. show example assigning different (pseudo) risk level county.
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt)  # assign each location a random category for different colors location_info <- unique(pd[,c("location_code")]) location_info[,category:=rep(   c("Good","Normal","Neutral","Bad","Very Bad"),   each=3)[1:.N] ] location_info[,category:=factor(   category,   levels=c("Good","Normal","Neutral","Bad","Very Bad")   ) ] print(location_info) #>     location_code category #>  1:      county11     Good #>  2:      county15     Good #>  3:      county18     Good #>  4:      county03   Normal #>  5:      county30   Normal #>  6:      county34   Normal #>  7:      county38  Neutral #>  8:      county42  Neutral #>  9:      county46  Neutral #> 10:      county50      Bad #> 11:      county54      Bad  # join the map data.table pd[location_info,on="location_code",category:=category]  q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,     y = lat,     group = group,     fill=category   ),    color="black",    size=0.25 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + coord_quickmap() # it is possible to use the color palette provided in fhiplot # q <- q + fhiplot::scale_fill_fhi("Category", palette = "map_seq_complete", direction = 1) q <- q + labs(title="") q <- q + theme_void() q

title: Customize your maps
text: can add labels county index onto maps. several options adding texts graph ggplot2. recommend geom_label() add labels label overlap occurs, otherwise recommend using ggrepel::geom_label_repel().  Labels can easily added layouts, Oslo wards.
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,     y = lat,     group = group,     fill = location_code   ),     color="black",   size=0.1 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = splmaps::nor_nuts3_position_geolabels_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, label = location_code)   ) # ggrepel::geom_label_repel() for avoiding overlap q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = splmaps::oslo_ward_position_geolabels_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(label = location_code),   color = "red",   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines") ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q

title: Customize your maps
text: convenient use spldata package enrich Norway Oslo maps external information, location name population. illustrate .

what: Add county name and population to Norway map
title: Customize your maps
code:
# enrich with population and location name dpop_2020 <- fhidata::norway_population_b2020[   year == '2020',   .(pop_total = sum(pop)),   keyby = location_code ]   # join, create label labels <- copy(splmaps::nor_nuts3_position_geolabels_b2020_insert_oslo_dt) labels[   dpop_2020,    on = "location_code",   pop_total := pop_total ] labels[   spldata::norway_locations_names_b2020,    on = "location_code",   location_name := location_name ] labels[, label := paste0(location_name, '
', pop_total)] print(head(labels)) #>    location_code  long      lat pop_total        location_name #> 1:      county30  8.85 60.60000   1241165                Viken #> 2:      county03 20.85 62.00000    693494                 Oslo #> 3:      county34 11.00 61.86886    371385            Innlandet #> 4:      county38  8.50 59.32481    419396 Vestfold og Telemark #> 5:      county42  7.80 58.30000    307231                Agder #> 6:      county11  6.10 58.70000    479892             Rogaland #>                           label #> 1:               Viken
1241165 #> 2:                 Oslo
693494 #> 3:            Innlandet
371385 #> 4: Vestfold og Telemark
419396 #> 5:                Agder
307231 #> 6:             Rogaland
479892  # plot pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = pd,    mapping = aes(     x = long,     y = lat,     group = group,     fill = location_code   ),   color="black",   size=0.1 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + ggrepel::geom_label_repel(   data = labels,   mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat, label = label) ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "") q

what: Add location name for ward and population for Oslo map
title: Customize your maps
code:
# enrich with population and location name dpop_2020 <- fhidata::norway_population_b2020[   year == '2020',   .(pop_total = sum(pop)),   keyby = location_code ]  # join, create label labels <- copy(splmaps::oslo_ward_position_geolabels_b2020_default_dt) labels[   dpop_2020,    on = "location_code",   pop_total := pop_total ] labels[   spldata::norway_locations_names_b2020,    on = "location_code",   location_name := location_name ] labels[, label := paste0(location_name, '
', pop_total)] print(head(labels)) #>     location_code     long      lat pop_total  location_name #> 1: wardoslo030101 10.79760 59.91010     58671     Gamle Oslo #> 2: wardoslo030102 10.78000 59.92567     62423    Grünerløkka #> 3: wardoslo030103 10.76683 59.93981     45089         Sagene #> 4: wardoslo030104 10.73555 59.91230     38945 St. Hanshaugen #> 5: wardoslo030105 10.66500 59.89925     59269        Frogner #> 6: wardoslo030106 10.65000 59.92500     34569         Ullern #>                    label #> 1:     Gamle Oslo
58671 #> 2:    Grünerløkka
62423 #> 3:         Sagene
45089 #> 4: St. Hanshaugen
38945 #> 5:        Frogner
59269 #> 6:         Ullern
34569  q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = labels,   mapping = aes(label = label),   color = "red",   size = 3,   label.size = 0.1,   label.r = grid::unit(0, "lines") ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q

title: Layout
text: 3 layout options Norway map: default, split insert Oslo. Oslo county map, default layout.

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_lau2_map_b2020_default_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(data = pd, aes( x = long, y = lat, group = group),                        color="black", fill="white", size=0.1) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Default layout") q

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_lau2_map_b2020_split_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(data = pd, aes( x = long, y = lat, group = group),                        color="black", fill="white", size=0.1) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Split layout") q

title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::nor_lau2_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(data = pd, aes( x = long, y = lat, group = group),                        color="black", fill="white", size=0.1)  # add title "Oslo" q <- q + annotate(   "text",    x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,    y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo"   ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Insert Oslo layout") q

previous_headings: Layout options > Norway layout: insert oslo
title: Layout
code: pd <- copy(splmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2020_default_dt) q <- ggplot() q <- q + geom_polygon(data = pd, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group),                        color="black", fill="white", size=0.1) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q <- q + labs(title = "Oslo wards") q

title: Naming scheme
text: content map data contains. Currently focus 2 scopes: country (Norway) city (Oslo)

title: Naming scheme
text: geographic granularity, defines border county, municipality ward. follow EU definition territorial unit (NUTS, LAU) applicable. NUTS3: Nomenclature Territorial Unit level 3. Equivalent fylke (county) Norway. LAU2: Local Administrative Unit level 2. Equivalent kommune (municipality) Norway. ward: district within municipality. Bydel Norwegian. far data Oslo. xxx: used plotting position_title. (see example)

title: Naming scheme
text: type data object distinguish whether ’s geographical map coordinate label positions. map: map data, either data.table sf class. position geolabels: geographical coordinates position labels, e.g. “county03” “Oslo”. position title (insert oslo): geographical coordinate position title. far ’s layout: insert_oslo. (see example)

title: Naming scheme
text: Due recent redistricting, exist multiple versions county borders. provide maps match borders following years: 2020: current border, map contains 11 counties. 2019: border redistricting 2020. map contains 19 counties. 2017: border redistricting 2018. information counties Norway can found .

title: Naming scheme
text: Map layout, see section examples.

title: Naming scheme
text: R class map object. data.table: applicable maps label/title coordinates. sf: simple feature spatial vector data. sf.

title: Interactive maps
text: provide option use sf class object create interactive maps. requres leaflet package.
code: pd_county <- splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_default_sf leaflet::leaflet(   pd_county,   options = leaflet::leafletOptions(preferCanvas = F) ) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(leaflet::providers$Esri.WorldGrayCanvas) %>%   leaflet::addPolygons(     weight = 0.3,     opacity = 1,     color = "black", fillColor = "white",     fillOpacity = 0.9   )

title: Authors and Citation
text: package proudly brought : Richard Aubrey White. Author, maintainer. Chi Zhang. Author. See changelog contributors. 🙏

title: Authors and Citation
text: White RA, Zhang C (2022). splmaps: Preformatted Maps Norway Need Geolibraries. https://docs.sykdomsuplsen./splmaps, https://github.com/sykdomspulsen-org/splmaps.
code: @Manual{,   title = {splmaps: Preformatted Maps of Norway That Don't Need Geolibraries},   author = {Richard Aubrey White and Chi Zhang},   year = {2022},   note = {https://docs.sykdomsuplsen.no/splmaps, https://github.com/sykdomspulsen-org/splmaps}, }

title: Preformatted Maps of Norway That Don't Need Geolibraries
text: splmaps helps create preformatted maps Norway generally need geolibraries.helps public health reporting purposes different geographic levels Norway. following geographic granularities included: County Municipality City ward (Oslo) convenient visualize maps additional information, either using text labels color palettes. Read introduction vignette run help(package="splmaps").

title: Preformatted Maps of Norway That Don't Need Geolibraries
text: splverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing infectious disease surveillance. want install dev versions (access packages haven’t released CRAN), run usethis::edit_r_profile() edit .Rprofile. write : Save file restart R. can now install splverse packages drat repository.
code: options(   repos = structure(c(     SPLVERSE  = "https://docs.sykdomspulsen.no/drat/",     CRAN      = "https://cran.rstudio.com"   )) ) install.packages("splmaps")

title: Maps of Norwegian counties with an insert for Oslo in data.table format — nor_nuts3_map_bxxxx_insert_oslo_dt
text: Borders 2020, 2019, 2017 provided.

title: Maps of Norwegian counties with an insert for Oslo in data.table format — nor_nuts3_map_bxxxx_insert_oslo_dt
code: # 2020 borders library(ggplot2) q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2020_insert_oslo_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2020_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q   # 2019 borders library(ggplot2) q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2019_insert_oslo_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2019_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2019_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q   # 2017 borders library(ggplot2) q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::nor_nuts3_map_b2017_insert_oslo_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + annotate(   "text",   x = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2017_insert_oslo_dt$long,   y = splmaps::nor_xxx_position_title_insert_oslo_b2017_insert_oslo_dt$lat,   label = "Oslo" ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q

title: Map of Oslo wards (bydeler) in data.table format — oslo_ward_map_bxxxx_default_dt
text: long Location code. lat Location name. order order line plotted . group Needs used 'group' aesthetic ggplot2. location_code Location code (ward code). object class data.table (inherits data.frame) 15 rows 3 columns.

title: Map of Oslo wards (bydeler) in data.table format — oslo_ward_map_bxxxx_default_dt
text: Borders provided 2020.

title: Map of Oslo wards (bydeler) in data.table format — oslo_ward_map_bxxxx_default_dt
code: library(ggplot2) q <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = long, y = lat)) q <- q + geom_polygon(   data = splmaps::oslo_ward_map_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(group = group, fill = location_code),   color = "black",   fill = "white",   size = 0.2 ) q <- q + geom_label(   data = splmaps::oslo_ward_position_geolabels_b2020_default_dt,   mapping = aes(label = location_code),   color = "red" ) q <- q + theme_void() q <- q + coord_quickmap() q
